question: Based on the given evidence, is the hypothesis 'Jack is bad at mid-range shots.' true, false, or uncertain? The final answer should be 'True', 'False', or 'Uncertain'. Only answer 'Uncertain' if the reasoning results from different evidences conflict with each other.

content.source_1: No trick-shot artist on Yale's varsity team struggles with half-court shots.
content.source_2: Every Yale varsity player either struggles with half-court shots or has a high 3-point percentage.
content.source_3: Any Yale varsity player with a high 3-point percentage is solid at shooting 2-pointers.
content.source_4: Any Yale varsity player who is solid at shooting 2-pointers is not bad at mid-range shots.
content.source_5: Jack is on Yale's varsity team.
content.source_6: Jack is either a trick-shot artist or he has a high 3-point percentage.
content.source_7: Players who struggle with half-court shots tend to also be bad at mid-range shots.
content.source_8: Trick-shot specialists often neglect mid-range fundamentals and end up bad at mid-range.
